title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Japan raises nuclear power goal in post-Fukushima shift
items.description: A new energy plan cites growing demand from power-hungry AI data centres and semiconductor plants.

items.title: Can President Trump ignore Congress' spending laws? The debate over 'impoundment'
items.description: Since taking office, the Trump administration and DOGE have been seeking to unilaterally override the spending plans set by Congress. Can they do that...

items.title: New law in Vietnam derided as bid to quell all critique of communist rule
items.description: A rights group calls Vietnam's new "Decree 147" social media crackdown a bid by the Communist Party to put an "icy stranglehold on free speech."

items.title: 'Everyone must go': New Zealand's tourism drive draws ire
items.description: What was meant as a catchy tagline has been dubbed tone-deaf amid high emigration and unemployment.

items.title: Top U.S., Russian diplomats meet on improving ties, ending Ukraine war
items.description: Senior officials from the U.S. and Russia meet in Saudi Arabia on improving ties and ending the war in Ukraine - but Ukraine isn't invited.

items.title: A look at recent aviation disasters in North America
14 killed in narco gang clashes as police warn of "reprisals"
items.description: In one incident, gunmen on motorcycles fired into a crowd gathered outside a grocery store, killing a child and six adult, police said.

items.title: Germany's tensions over immigration laid bare ahead of election
items.description: In the western city of Oberhausen the BBC finds conflicting attitudes towards immigration ahead of the vote.

items.title: An ancient Roman basilica has been discovered below London's financial district
items.description: The basilica, dating back some 1,900 years, was found during excavations that took place as part of the demolition of a building in the heart of Londo...

items.title: Powering a cleaner future for mobile work worldwide
items.description: Instagrid has developed high-performance portable power supplies that provide fume-free, silent alternatives to harmful gas-powered combustion generat...

items.title: 'Died for stealing chocolate': Pakistan anger over death of child maid
items.description: Pakistani police have filed murder charges against a couple who employed the 13-year-old girl.

items.title: Mexico announces big meth seizure amid pressure from Trump
items.description: Mexico has announced a series of major drug discoveries in recent weeks in an apparent attempt to highlight increased efforts to combat drug smuggling...

items.title: As sports betting has soared, more people search online for help with gambling addiction
items.description: A study shows more people are looking for help to manage gambling addiction, in the years after a Supreme Court decision allowed online sports betting...

items.title: Ukraine Talks, U.S. Health Agency Cuts, NYC Mayor Eric Adams Fallout

items.title: Dying to serve: Dozens of recruits have died nationwide while training to become police officers
items.description: At least 29 recruits have died during basic training at law enforcement academies nationwide in the last decade.

items.title: Delta jet flips upside down on a snowy Toronto runway and all 80 aboard survive
All passengers survive crash landing as plane flips at Toronto airport
items.description: Eighteen of the 80 people on board were injured after the Delta plane overturned on landing.

items.title: Human gene variant alters the voices of mice
items.description: A new study shows that giving mice the human version of a gene changes their squeak, suggesting some of the genetic underpinnings of language.
